page.title: 04GREAT MUSGRAVE VILLAGE
page.content: GREAT MUSGRAVE IS A NICE LITTLE VILLAGE WITH A LOT OF OLD HOUSES.IT DATES BACK TO THE BRONZE AGE. THERE WAS A RAILWAY WITH A STATION.A MAN CALLED MR BEECHINGS STOPPED IT.THE STATION IS NOW A HOUSE. THERE IS A OLD SCHOOL IN ONE OF THE FIELDS. THERE ARE BRONZE AGE FARMING LYNCHETS. THERE ARE THREE RIVERS IN MUSGRAVE, EDEN,SWINDALE AND AUGILL BECKS. MUSGRAVE CHURCH IS ONE OF THE FEW CHURCHES THAT DOES THE RUSHBEARING. THE RUSHBARING IS ON THE FIRST SATURDAY IN JULY. A GHOST STORY IS ATTACHED TO THIS VILLGE. IT IS A TALE ABOUT A SUSPECTED MURDER BACK IN 1900 WHEN A LADY IN THE PUB HEARD GHOSTLY VOICES ON THE EDEN. A MAN WAS WALKING HOME AND THE NEXT DAY HIS BODY WAS FOUND DOWN THE RIVER.
